intro: Jussiaea carophyllaea, commonly known as the pink sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils, often forming dense mats to reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically arranged in compact inflorescences, and it is often found in coastal dunes or inland deserts. Jussiaea carophyllaea is a hardy species that plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
